body.p:
Louisville Nov 15th 1860
To B Magoffin
Gov of Ky.
Respected Sir-

I recd a Communication last evening from Genl Buckner informing me that your Excellency has refused to accept a resignation tendered by me- Since having done so I have had occasion and time to examine the Law and find that my act in so tendering a resignation was unnecessary- In proof thereof I refer your Excellency to ยง24, art 6th of the Militia Law which refers to Section 1st Art 7th of the Constitution of this State- Althought having recd a Commission I have never complied with either, by taking the oaths prescribed, and never will, consequently never having accepted by complying therewith I have never qualified as an officer of the Ky state Guard, and with past experience shall never consent to be a member thereof= Is not my position correct?-

I am with Respect
Your obdt Servt
W E Woodruff

P S- I have addressed a similar communicatiion to Genl B, but his absence from town has not enabled it to reach him, hence this Communication
Recd Nov 17. 60
B. M
